title: 2-oxoacid:ferredoxin oxidoreductase detector
description: This feature specifically detects genes encoding 2-oxoacid:ferredoxin oxidoreductase enzymes, particularly the beta subunit (porB/korB). The activation pattern shows sharp, high-intensity spikes directly over these genes. These enzymes play crucial roles in microbial energy metabolism, especially in anaerobic respiration and fermentation pathways, catalyzing the oxidative decarboxylation of 2-oxoacids while reducing ferredoxin. The pattern is highly consistent across diverse bacterial taxa including firmicutes and other bacterial phyla, suggesting this feature captures a conserved sequence motif within these essential metabolic genes.
